title: John V. Orth, “Self-Defense” (The Green Bag, 2010)
description:
Today I had the pleasure of interviewing my legal history professor at Carolina Law, John V. Orth about his short story Self-Defense (14 Green Bag 2D Autumn 2010). Orth, who is well known for his more traditional legal scholarship, has made a powerful venture into fiction.  The story, which begins by describing an ordinary daily dog-walk, leads its reader into deep ponderings about the state of American law and society.
